author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 10. Kakudhavagga
segments.en: 10. With Kakudha

segments.pli: 100. Kakudhatherasutta
segments.en: 100. With Kakudha

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kakudho nāma koliyaputto āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa upaṭṭhāko adhunākālaṅkato aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapanno.
segments.en: At that time the Koliyan named Kakudha—Venerable Mahāmoggallāna’s attendant—had recently passed away and been reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.

segments.pli: Tassa evarūpo attabhāvapaṭilābho hoti—seyyathāpi nāma dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettāni.
segments.en: He was reincarnated in a life-form that was two or three times the size of a Magadhan village with its fields.

segments.pli: So tena attabhāvapaṭilābhena neva attānaṃ no paraṃ byābādheti.
segments.en: But with that life-form he didn’t obstruct himself or others.

segments.pli: Atha kho kakudho devaputto yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho kakudho devaputto āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the god Kakudha went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, bowed, stood to one side. and said to him,

segments.pli: “devadattassa, bhante, evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji:
segments.en: “Sir, this fixed desire arose in Devadatta:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pariharissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘I will lead the mendicant Saṅgha.’

segments.pli: Sahacittuppādā ca, bhante, devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihīno”ti.
segments.en: And as that thought arose, Devadatta lost that psychic power.”

segments.pli: Idamavoca kakudho devaputto.
segments.en: That’s what the god Kakudha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
segments.en: Then he bowed and respectfully circled Mahāmoggallāna, keeping him on his right side, before vanishing right there.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Mahāmoggallāna went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.

segments.pli: “Kakudho nāma, bhante, koliyaputto mamaṃ upaṭṭhāko adhunākālaṅkato aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapanno hoti.
Tassa evarūpo attabhāvapaṭilābho—seyyathāpi nāma dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettāni.
So tena attabhāvapaṭilābhena neva attānaṃ no paraṃ byābādheti.
Atha kho, bhante, kakudho devaputto yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho, bhante, kakudho devaputto maṃ etadavoca:
‘devadattassa, bhante, evarūpaṃ icchāgataṃ uppajji—
ahaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pariharissāmīti.
Sahacittuppādā ca, bhante, devadatto tassā iddhiyā parihīno’ti.
Idamavoca, bhante, kakudho devaputto.
Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyī”ti.
“Kiṃ pana te, moggallāna, kakudho devaputto cetasā ceto paricca vidito:
segments.en: “But Moggallāna, did you comprehend the god Kakudha’s mind, and know that

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci kakudho devaputto bhāsati sabbaṃ taṃ tatheva hoti, no aññathā’”ti?
segments.en: everything he says is correct and not otherwise?”

segments.pli: “Cetasā ceto paricca vidito me, bhante, kakudho devaputto:
segments.en: “Indeed I did, sir.”

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kiñci kakudho devaputto bhāsati sabbaṃ taṃ tatheva hoti, no aññathā’”ti.
“Rakkhassetaṃ, moggallāna, vācaṃ.
segments.en: “Mark these words, Moggallāna!

segments.pli: Rakkhassetaṃ, moggallāna, vācaṃ.
segments.en: Mark these words!

segments.pli: Idāni so moghapuriso attanāva attānaṃ pātukarissati.
segments.en: Now that silly man Devadatta will expose himself by his own deeds.

segments.pli: Pañcime, moggallāna, satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: Moggallāna, there are these five teachers found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, moggallāna, ekacco satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno ‘parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṃkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: Firstly, some teacher with impure conduct claims: ‘I am pure in ethics. My ethical conduct is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ sāvakā evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: But their disciples know:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhasīlo samāno parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṃkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: ‘This teacher has impure ethical conduct, but claims to be ethically pure.

segments.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
segments.en: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma:
segments.en: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?

segments.pli: ‘sammannati kho pana cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena;
segments.en: But they consent to robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
segments.en: A person will be recognized by their own deeds.’

segments.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, moggallāna, satthāraṃ sāvakā sīlato rakkhanti;
segments.en: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s conduct,

segments.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi sīlato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati. (1)
segments.en: and the teacher expects them to do so.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, moggallāna, idhekacco satthā aparisuddhājīvo samāno ‘parisuddhājīvomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddho me ājīvo pariyodāto asaṅkiliṭṭho’ti.
segments.en: Furthermore, some teacher with impure livelihood claims: ‘I am pure in livelihood. My livelihood is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ sāvakā evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: But their disciples know:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhājīvo samāno parisuddhājīvomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddho me ājīvo pariyodāto asaṅkiliṭṭho’ti.
segments.en: ‘This teacher has impure livelihood, but claims to have pure livelihood.

segments.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
segments.en: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma:
segments.en: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?

segments.pli: ‘sammannati kho pana cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena;
segments.en: But they consent to robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
segments.en: A person will be recognized by their own deeds.’

segments.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, moggallāna, satthāraṃ sāvakā ājīvato rakkhanti;
segments.en: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s livelihood,

segments.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi ājīvato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati. (2)
segments.en: and the teacher expects them to do so.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, moggallāna, idhekacco satthā aparisuddhadhammadesano samāno ‘parisuddhadhammadesanomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhā me dhammadesanā pariyodātā asaṅkiliṭṭhā’ti.
segments.en: Furthermore, some teacher with impure teaching claims: ‘I am pure in teaching. My teaching is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ sāvakā evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: But their disciples know:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhadhammadesano samāno parisuddhadhammadesanomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhā me dhammadesanā pariyodātā asaṅkiliṭṭhā’ti.
segments.en: ‘This teacher has impure teaching, but claims to have pure teaching.

segments.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
segments.en: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma:
segments.en: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?

segments.pli: ‘sammannati kho pana cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena;
segments.en: But they consent to robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
segments.en: A person will be recognized by their own deeds.’

segments.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, moggallāna, satthāraṃ sāvakā dhammadesanato rakkhanti;
segments.en: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s teaching,

segments.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi dhammadesanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati. (3)
segments.en: and the teacher expects them to do so.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, moggallāna, idhekacco satthā aparisuddhaveyyākaraṇo samāno ‘parisuddhaveyyākaraṇomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me veyyākaraṇaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: Furthermore, some teacher with impure answers claims: ‘I am pure in how I answer. My answers are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ sāvakā evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: But their disciples know:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhaveyyākaraṇo samāno parisuddhaveyyākaraṇomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me veyyākaraṇaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: ‘This teacher has impure answers, but claims to have pure answers.

segments.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
segments.en: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma:
segments.en: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?

segments.pli: ‘sammannati kho pana cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena;
segments.en: But they consent to robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
segments.en: A person will be recognized by their own deeds.’

segments.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, moggallāna, satthāraṃ sāvakā veyyākaraṇato rakkhanti;
segments.en: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s answers,

segments.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi veyyākaraṇato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati. (4)
segments.en: and the teacher expects them to do so.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, moggallāna, idhekacco satthā aparisuddhañāṇadassano samāno ‘parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: Furthermore, some teacher with impure knowledge and vision claims: ‘I am pure in knowledge and vision. My knowledge and vision are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ sāvakā evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: But their disciples know:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ satthā aparisuddhañāṇadassano samāno parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī’ti paṭijānāti ‘parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: ‘This teacher has impure knowledge and vision, but claims to have pure knowledge and vision.

segments.pli: Mayañceva kho pana gihīnaṃ āroceyyāma, nāssassa manāpaṃ.
segments.en: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho panassa amanāpaṃ, kathaṃ naṃ mayaṃ tena samudācareyyāma:
segments.en: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?

segments.pli: ‘sammannati kho pana cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena;
segments.en: But they consent to robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: yaṃ tumo karissati tumova tena paññāyissatī’ti.
segments.en: A person will be recognized by their own deeds.’

segments.pli: Evarūpaṃ kho, moggallāna, satthāraṃ sāvakā ñāṇadassanato rakkhanti;
segments.en: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s knowledge and vision,

segments.pli: evarūpo ca pana satthā sāvakehi ñāṇadassanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsati.
segments.en: and the teacher expects them to do so.

segments.pli: Ime kho, moggallāna, pañca satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. (5)
segments.en: These are the five teachers found in the world.

segments.pli: Ahaṃ kho pana, moggallāna, parisuddhasīlo samāno ‘parisuddhasīlomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddhaṃ me sīlaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: But Moggallāna, I have pure ethical conduct, and I claim: ‘I am pure in ethical conduct. My ethical conduct is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā sīlato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi sīlato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
segments.en: My disciples don’t cover up my conduct, and I don’t expect them to.

segments.pli: Parisuddhājīvo samāno ‘parisuddhājīvomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddho me ājīvo pariyodāto asaṅkiliṭṭho’ti.
segments.en: I have pure livelihood, and I claim: ‘I am pure in livelihood. My livelihood is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā ājīvato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi ājīvato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
segments.en: My disciples don’t cover up my livelihood, and I don’t expect them to.

segments.pli: Parisuddhadhammadesano samāno ‘parisuddhadhammadesanomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddhā me dhammadesanā pariyodātā asaṅkiliṭṭhā’ti.
segments.en: I have pure teaching, and I claim: ‘I am pure in teaching. My teaching is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā dhammadesanato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi dhammadesanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
segments.en: My disciples don’t cover up my teaching, and I don’t expect them to.

segments.pli: Parisuddhaveyyākaraṇo samāno ‘parisuddhaveyyākaraṇomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddhaṃ me veyyākaraṇaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: I have pure answers, and I claim: ‘I am pure in how I answer. My answers are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā veyyākaraṇato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi veyyākaraṇato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmi.
segments.en: My disciples don’t cover up my answers, and I don’t expect them to.

segments.pli: Parisuddhañāṇadassano samāno ‘parisuddhañāṇadassanomhī’ti paṭijānāmi ‘parisuddhaṃ me ñāṇadassanaṃ pariyodātaṃ asaṅkiliṭṭhan’ti.
segments.en: I have pure knowledge and vision, and I claim: ‘I am pure in knowledge and vision. My knowledge and vision are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’

segments.pli: Na ca maṃ sāvakā ñāṇadassanato rakkhanti, na cāhaṃ sāvakehi ñāṇadassanato rakkhaṃ paccāsīsāmī”ti.
segments.en: My disciples don’t cover up my knowledge and vision, and I don’t expect them to.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Kakudhavaggo pañcamo.
Dve sampadā byākaraṇaṃ,
phāsu akuppapañcamaṃ;
Sutaṃ kathā āraññako,
sīho ca kakudho dasāti.
Dutiyo paṇṇāsako samatto.
